p: There is strong evidence in the literature implying that sphingolipids and glycosphingolipids play an intimate role in HCV replication in liver cells. First, Merz et al. utilized lipid mass spectrometry to demonstrate that affinity-purified HCV particles are enriched in sphingomyelin [ 39], suggesting that sphingolipids are integral components of HCV envelope. This study did not address the role of sphingomyelin in HCV propagation, but another study by Aizaki et al. [ 40] demonstrated that sphingomyelin facilitates HCV internalization, perhaps via fusion of the virus envelope with endocytic membrane to release HCV genome into the cytoplasm.
